required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Team-based Ergonomics Educational Model for Workplace WELLNESS Improvement: A Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Team-based Ergonomics Educational Model for Workplace WELLNESS Improvement: A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: This research is being done to explore the potential benefit of a physical therapist-guided stretching program on musculoskeletal pain and well-being.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from 3 month time point to 6 month time point
primary_outcome.description: The 36-Item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) is a set of generic, coherent, and easily administered quality-of-life measures.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from 3 month time point to 6 month time point
primary_outcome.description: The Cornell Musculoskeletal Discomfort Questionnaires (CMDQ) is a questionnaire based on previous published research studies of musculoskeletal discomfort among office workers.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 3 months, 6 months, change from 3 month time point to 6 month time point
secondary_outcome.description: The sit and reach test is a common measure of flexibility, and specifically measures the flexibility of the lower back and hamstring muscles.
The 36-Item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) is a set of generic, coherent, and easily administered quality-of-life measures.
The Cornell Musculoskeletal Discomfort Questionnaires (CMDQ) is a questionnaire based on previous published research studies of musculoskeletal discomfort among office workers.

arm_group.description: During the initial 3 month control period, subjects are asked not to begin any new exercise or stretching program during this time. During the 3 month intervention period that follows, subjects will participate in in-person physical therapist-led instructional sessions three times per week. Each stretch will be performed twice, one on the left and one on the right. The therapist will describe what to do and briefly demonstrate each stretch. Stretches will be held for 45-60 seconds with therapist instructions and modification as needed based on subject technique.

During the initial 3 month control period, subjects are asked not to begin any new exercise or stretching program during this time. During the 3 month intervention period that follows, subjects will complete sessions three times per week, led by a physical therapist and viewed remotely via pre-recorded video using a smartphone application.

intervention.description: Head/neck stretches Head tilt side to side Cross-chest stretch Torso stretches Side stretch Mid-back stretch Lower limb Standing quadriceps stretch Standing hamstring stretch

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HMC/COM staff (faculty, residents, fellows, APPs, physical/occupational therapists, nurses, schedulers, etc.)
- At least 18 years old
- Willing and able to participate in all study procedures
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
- Group 2 subjects must have access to a computer with internet or an iPhone or Android smartphone
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who do not meet all inclusion criteria will be excluded from the study.

overall_official.affiliation: Penn State Health Milton S. Hershey Medical Center

facility.name: Penn State Health Milton S. Hershey Medical Center
